build.description: The build configuration specifying how to compile the canister's source code into a WebAssembly module, including the adapter to use.

sync.description: The configuration specifying how to sync the canister

path.description: Local path on-disk to read a WASM file from

sha256.description: Optional sha256 checksum for the recipe template. If provided, the integrity of the recipe will be verified against this hash

type.description:
An identifier for a recipe, it can have one of the following formats:

`file://<path_to_recipe>` - point to a local recipe template

`http://<url_to_recipe>` - point to a remote recipe template

`@<registry>/<recipe_name>[@<version>]` - Point to a recipe in a known registry.

For now the only registry is the `dfinity` regitry at https://github.com/dfinity/icp-cli-recipes `version` is optional and defaults to `latest`

It is always recommended to pin the version and provide a hash for it in the `sha256` field

url.description: Url to fetch the remote WASM file from

Settings.description: Canister settings, such as compute and memory allocation.

compute_allocation.description: Compute allocation (0 to 100). Represents guaranteed compute capacity.

environment_variables.description: Environment variables for the canister as key-value pairs. These variables are accessible within the canister and can be used to configure behavior without hardcoding values in the WASM module.

freezing_threshold.description: Freezing threshold in seconds. Controls how long a canister can be inactive before being frozen.

memory_allocation.description: Memory allocation in bytes. If unset, memory is allocated dynamically.

reserved_cycles_limit.description: Reserved cycles limit. If set, the canister cannot consume more than this many cycles.

wasm_memory_limit.description: Wasm memory limit in bytes. Sets an upper bound for Wasm heap growth.

wasm_memory_threshold.description: Wasm memory threshold in bytes. Triggers a callback when exceeded.

Step.description:
Identifies the type of adapter used to build the canister, along with its configuration.

The adapter type is specified via the `type` field in the YAML file. For example:

```yaml type: rust package: my_canister ```

oneOf.description: Represents a canister built using a custom script or command. This variant allows for flexible build processes defined by the user.
Command used to build a canister
Set of commands used to build a canister

anyOf.description: Local path on-disk to read a WASM file from
Remote url to fetch a WASM file from

oneOf.description: Represents a pre-built canister. This variant allows for retrieving a canister WASM from various sources.

sha256.description: Optional sha256 checksum of the WASM

Step2.description:
Identifies the type of adapter used to sync the canister, along with its configuration.

The adapter type is specified via the `type` field in the YAML file. For example:

```yaml type: script command: echo "synchronizing canister" ```

oneOf.description: Represents a canister synced using a custom script or command. This variant allows for flexible sync processes defined by the user.
Command used to build a canister
Set of commands used to build a canister
Represents syncing of an assets canister
Directory used to synchronize an assets canister
Set of directories used to synchronize an assets canister

Steps.description: Describes how the canister should be built into WebAssembly, including the adapters and build steps responsible for the build.

Steps2.description: Describes how the canister should be built into WebAssembly, including the adapters and build steps responsible for the build.

name.description: The unique name of the canister as defined in this manifest.

settings.description: The configuration specifying the various settings when creating the canister.
